channel.title: Home on NeuroFab
channel.description: Recent content in Home on NeuroFab

item.title: Key Concepts of Reinforcement Learning: What You Need to Know
item.description: üåç Imagine a world where machines learn to make decisions, adjusting their strategies over time to achieve specific goals. This world is no longer just a vision of the future, but a reality thanks to Reinforcement Learning (RL). If you’re curious about how this technology works, you’re in the right place. In this article, I will explain in a simple and clear manner the essential concepts of RL, an artificial intelligence technique that allows machines to learn independently, without supervision.

item.title: Table of content
item.description: Table of content This theme supports displaying table of content (ToC) in blog posts. Parameters You can manage a ToC with two parameters: global toc parameter; post toc parameter. The post toc parameter has higher priority than the global toc parameter. Enable table of content on all posts To enable ToC on all posts (globally) set parameter toc to true in hugo.toml. [params] toc = true To disable ToC globally, simply ignore the toc parameter or set it to false.

item.title: Math Typesetting - use Mathematical notation in blog posts
item.description: Mathematical notation in a Hugo project can be enabled by using third party JavaScript libraries.

item.title: Markdown Syntax Guide
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

item.title: Rich Content
item.description: Hugo ships with several Built-in Shortcodes for rich content, along with a Privacy Config and a set of Simple Shortcodes that enable static and no-JS versions of various social media embeds.

item.title: Emoji Support
item.description: Emoji can be enabled in a Hugo project in a number of ways.

item.title: About Me
item.description: üëã Welcome to My Blog! My name is Thibault, and if you’re here, it’s likely because, like me, you’re passionate about data science and its countless possibilities. I’m currently in my final year of engineering school, specializing in applied mathematics and modeling, fields that fuel my curiosity and desire to understand the world around us. Why This Blog? Over the years, computing and data science have become central to my life, and this blog was born out of that passion.
